reviews.review_msg: The class overall was very interesting, but having quizzes made zero sense for a class like this. There was also very few assignments that were done in the class and if you did bad on one well there goes a chance at a good grade. Really not worth taking if you have alternatives available.

Christiana Miewald is not a great prof. I really did not need to take this course, but took it out of curiosity and I feel like a class based on food really should not have quizzes on it. If you need a course to take for a requirement there are way more option to take over this one

Class was relatively interesting for me, overall presentation was solid. Also there was no final exam which I enjoyed and most of the grade was from projects. Some downsides were that the grading criteria was pretty vague and it seemed like almost everyone got almost exactly the same marks, which seemed to be between 75-80% mostly.
I did very well in this class, but her lectures were boring.
She is a well prepared academic, but she should not teach. You can't gain respect from the student by raising your voice. Too rude. Should stick to research.

Although I am doing pretty well, I would never take a class with her again. Marks critical essays hard, classes are hard to follow, fails to explain many concepts. Course reqs are not ideal. Way too many presentations, videos, activities in tutorials and not enough time dedicated to understanding material, readings etc. You really are on your own.
Learned a lot, but there were too many assignments. Make sure to attend class as there are no slides online and no recordings. There are penalties for skipping tutorial.

Great prof! Very easy to talk to, and extremely friendly.  I definitely did not find her condescending (like the previous poster). The material she taught was interesting, however I am not entirely fond of the use of powerpoint for lectures.  Overall, I thoroughly enjoyed her classes.

She comes off as bubbly and nice but she is very rude and condescending. Her tests are not difficult and straight forward if you memorize the lecture slides. She has very high expectations for papers. Lectures were bearable and content was repetitive.  Teaching is not her forte, she should stick to research. Stay far away.
